definition: to withdraw money/to take money out of the bank
to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid
section/paragraph/funds/CL:筆|笔[bi3],個|个[ge4]/classifier for versions or models (of a product)
special drawing rights (SDR), international currency of the IMF

sentences.english: I prefer to use debit card when shop on the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 我通常喜歡用提款卡在網上購物。

sentences.english: My kids think I am ATM.
sentences.chinese: 我孩子認爲我是提款機。

sentences.english: Exempt withdrawals made up to the required minimum amount from taxation.
sentences.chinese: 從稅收的要求的最低金額中免除提款。

sentences.english: But they didn't realize that ATMs are bolted to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 但是他們沒有意識到，提款機是閂在地上的。

sentences.english: I need to hit an ATM.
I need to hit an ATM.
I take out my cash card .
Withdrawals can be carried out by POs with 50 percent co-financing.
sentences.chinese: 提款可以根據訂單的百分之五十來共同融資。

sentences.english: You will notice that an ATM card for Barclays Bank is also in this envelope.
sentences.chinese: 你會注意到這個信封裏還有一張巴克萊銀行的提款卡。

sentences.english: I took out my cash card.
Such withdrawals reduce both the assets and the owners' equity of the organization.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的提款同時減少了企業的資產和業主權益。

sentences.english: The next day, Deborah took money out of the ATM.
sentences.chinese: 第二天Deborah從自動提款機取了錢出來。

sentences.english: Will I have to change my ATM password?
sentences.chinese: 我必須要改變我的自動提款卡的密碼嗎？

sentences.english: There is an ATM machine nearby.
You can get money from our banking machine twenty-four hours a day.
sentences.chinese: 我們的提款機二十四小時爲你服務。

sentences.english: How much does a new ATM card cost?
sentences.chinese: 一張新的自動提款卡要花多少錢？

definition: to withdraw money from a bank
to transfer (money to a bank account)
online banking/abbr. for 網上銀行|网上银行[wang3 shang4 yin2 hang2]
to pay a sum of money/payment
